mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Mountflorence, James C.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: By Mr. Morris's request at Paris, self today put in post office his dispatches to him; arrived yesterday in French ship L'aimable Antoinette in 60 days passage from Havre de Grace; nothing yet determined on fate of King and Queen in France, but Republican armies are "triumphing in every quarter"; gave account of France to printer here; will take dispatches for Governor Blount of governor of Kentucky; goes to southwest territory.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Blount, William, 1749-1800
Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1793 January 22, Norfolk, [Virginia] to Thomas Jefferson, n.p.
